title: Ticket #7656: Tradeoffs between query and xquery should be made clear in the docs
description:
The manual currently says, regarding query():

  This returns a list of ClassAd objects, meaning all results must be buffered in memory. This may be memory-intensive for large responses; we strongly recommend to utilize the =xquery()=

The first half of this is accurate, but the opinion at the end is just wrong: most people will not be doing a large enough query to warrant the need to use xquery, which has performance impacts on the submit machine. Instead of this scary warning, we should just clearly and explicitly state the differences between query and xquery and let users decide which they want.
